subject: This Week on Reliable Sources
body:
CNN.com










Coming up this Sunday on Reliable Sources: 

Open Season on Giuliani

He may be leading
the Republican polls, but Giuliani is taking a thrashing in the
press.	From his stance on abortion to his dressing as a woman
for a handful of comedy shows the attacks are coming fast and
furious, and often from the media on the right.  Is the former
mayor of New York getting a fair shake?

Romney Vs.
Sharpton

Al Sharpton has been in the news a lot
recently since he lead the charge against radio show host Don
Imus.  Is the press now giving him a pass after making
insensitive comments about republican candidate Mitt Romney's
religion?

Video Voyeurism

Has the
public's obsession with watching celebrity's gotten out of
control?  Paparazzi photos are one thing, but the recent spate
of personal tapes and videos of celebrities at their worst
personal moments have caused celebrity watching to take an ugly
turn.  Are the media crossing the line?  And the worse things
get for Paris Hilton, the more coverage she gets, what's that
all about?

Plus,  Journalists rub elbows with
the queen, local newspapers outsourcing to India, and why the
U.S. press is so much kinder to George W. Bush than the British
press is to Tony Blair. 

Join us this Sunday and
every Sunday at 10am ET / 7am PT for our critical look at the
media!
